name: Michael Burk
text:
It was decidedly fine. They've done a good job with social distancing and seem to be observing good precautions. The beer selection is more than adequate for a restaurant but disappointing for a place named "public house".

The house fries with sauces are a reasonable attempt at frites, but the fries came sans salt. They came with a mild chili-ketchup, aoili mayo, and a chipotle style sauce. The super salad was good, but did not differentiate itself from the dozens of similar salads.

The chicken and waffles looked nice but did not have the depth or heat hoped for. The crystal hot sauce was minimalistic. The corn dog looked to be dressed up but the acid was unbalanced with the other flavors making it more hippie than hipster.

Overall, it was very ok. We were hoping for a more "foodie" experience and were disappointed.

name: Lauren Rotman
text: Wanted to love this place as much as I love the downtown version but I just couldn’t. From the behavior of the hostesses to the bar tenders requiring IDs for each individual drink, this bar is a joke. Was saving a table while a friend bought my drink and she had to come get my ID to even order. What in the world? Who wants to wait 45 minute for a table? Don’t waste your time.

name: thomas cooper
text: Nice atmosphere, limited but tasty menu of foods. They have a number of specialty drinks. I tried a dirty martini which was watered down, costing them a star in my rating. Wait staff were attentive and friendly.

text: Great spot in the heart of Mountain Brook. Great food, great drinks, great service, great atmosphere. What more do you need?

text: The food was absolutely amazing. For an appetizer, we had the snack trio with the hummus and naan, stuffed peppadews, and olives. It was the perfect starter, the naan was super fresh and soft. For my entree, I chose the beet salad with grilled chicken. It was fresh, vibrant, and delicious! Can’t wait to dine here again.

text: A pleasant little surprise that’s is surprisingly attached to a Whole Foods.

name: Bham Local Guide
text: Great little surprise inside Whole Foods. 12 local beers on tap for tasting. Impressively good Barbeque.

name: Andrew Jump
text: I was not a huge fan of my meal here. I had brisket with Mac & cheese and collards. The brisket was moist, but fatty and not very tender. About 1/2 of the brisket was warm and the other 1/2 was room temperature. My guess this was due to it being kept in a warming pan. The Mac & cheese was pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary. The collards were, again, just OK. They had a bit of spice to them, which I like. My wife had the pulled pork, which appeared to be tender, but maybe a little dry. They had a good local beer selection on tap, which honestly is what gave this place a 3rd star for me. Without the beer and a couple of TVs, this would only be 2 stars. Otherwise, the restaurant itself was clean, but it should be considering it has only been open for a week or two.

name: MsIndy Red
text: A pub in a grocery store. Can't expect much and get just that.  Geared more toward a few craft selections than standard bottles.  Decent prices.

name: Aaron Dettling
text: I had the pulled pork sandwich and enjoyed it quite a lot. The bun was nice and fresh and soft. They have a nice spicy chipotle sauce which was my favorite of the available options. The Black Eyed Peas were a little undercooked for my taste but I guess that is pretty much the fashion nowadays to undercook everything. Overall for a place that doesn't have a barbecue pit attached to it the food was pretty darn good.

name: Gottfried Kibelka
text:
No vegetarian options.  I grabbed a slice of Pizza from the store and sat outside but I wasn't sure if that was appropriate.
Beer selection and $3 pints was tempting.

name: Houston Piatt
text: It was a good burger, and good selection of beer, nothing to write home about, but a good place to hang with friends over a beer

name: Marvin Goetz
text: Food seemed to be sitting in the warming pans for quite sometime which made it dry. Very clean place. Wish it had better fresh food, especially since it is part of whole foods.

name: Cynthia Timmerman
text: They no longer have bbq...only burgers so not sure why over a year later it's still called Hops and Sauce????.

name: Jermaine Hall
text: Chicken was dry. Server was nice

name: tres b
text: was closed in the early afternoon

name: Lexie F
text: Love it!

name: Jessica Halo
text: This was my second visit, the first was in march. Very similar results. My spouse and associates ordered 12 oz ribeyes. I ordered a 8oz filet. All were cooked perfectly to our specifications. There was a steak topping/dressing/accompaniment that was not in the description; possibly it was sauteed mushroom pieces. possibly just grill remnants from previous food cooked. There was not a pile of it, but it was on all four steaks that came to our table. It did not bother me or associates and had no overwhelming flavors but my spouse scraped it off because of an aversion to mushrooms, onions, and anything else that could be misunderstood. I chose aspaeagus and salad as sides. My asparagus was tender-crisp and well trimmed. Salad was basic using Iceberg. Had a couple ugly pieces i picked out but nothing major. I had ranch dressing which was homemade but not fantastic nor horrible. There was some dried herb or flavor that did not seem authentic to my ranch tastes but it was edible. I would like to try their  porterhouse but im just not ready to pay $38 for one steak. Overall, very nice meal for 20 minutes down the road. I will be back.  Below is a pic from march.

name: Christina Morales
text: Steak with sauteed mushrooms so freaking good!! This place is amazing

name: Yvonne Adams
text: We've been several times and have really enjoyed it. I have ordered something different even time, and everything has been great. Atmosphere is good - casual and very friendly. It isn't fast, so don't plan to hurry, but the food us worth the wait. Live music on the weekends on outside stage is fun for any crowd. It has become one of our favorite places, especially for hanging out with friends!

name: Didn't Say
text: The restaurant itself,  appearance,  was very nice.  You got a nice down to earth country vibe.  Friendly service,  nice people.  The food however,  was not all that.  I ordered the streak nachos and was served homemade potato chips that were way over cooked. And i ordered the chicken parm, the chicken was dry and it came with a house salad that the waitress didn't even bring out.

name: John Lynch
text:
Ordered appetizer and food at same time. Nearly 30 minutes later, asked where appetizer was. A couple that came in after us received their food about this time. Finally our appetizer showed up. It was sub-par. 30 minutes later, still no food. The host went and got our salads and brought to table. Explained that this wait time was unacceptable. There was approximately 25-30 customers, with several empty tables. Our server tried to tell us that the other couple had not ordered an appetizer like we had. She explained that she couldn't put in our food order until we got the appetizer we had to beg to get! She then went on to say "And there are a lot of people in here!" I looked around again, but just didn't see a lot of people. After requesting to speak with manager, and explaining the situation, we just asked to pay for our salads and appetizer. That's when our food came out!
This was our first and LAST visit! Unacceptable!

name: Michael Escott
text: The service and food is great!  Eric was our waiter and on the spot.  My wife and I enjoyed a Porterhouse steak that was seasoned  and cooked perfectly.  I went with medium rare and she did medium.   We have a few restrictions with our diet currently and asked for oil and vinegar for dressing for our salad.  It wasn't something they offered, but was willing to accommodate us and made us a dressing that was wonderful.  Definitely will be back here.  It is a great addition to the Fort Mitchell area.

name: Detra McKissic
text: I love this hometown restaurant... Nice friendly atmosphere... Had the pleasure of having a server name Mack wait our table ... He was outstanding! Very attentive to our table and didn't miss a beat.... THANKS MACK...

name: Heidi WuzHere
text: We always enjoy going here. Usually the ribs are loved by anyone that goes with me and I like the appetizer Cajun crab legs as my meal. They are always friendly when serving you and it's always a nice experience. 😊

name: aniyah
text: Food is great and so is the service. I would give five stars but it wasn't open three times when the website said it would be. Otherwise it is a great place and I highly recommend.

name: Michael Lake
text: It was a very busy Friday night and took our party of three about an hour to be seated. Appetizer came fairly quickly but main course took about an hour and a half longer to be brought to the table. The steaks were not done well and fries were dry and overcooked. Our waitress was given an opportunity to explain the extreme delays but passed it off as a busy night rather than a lost order or perhaps having to raise and slaughter the animals all in one night. This has been one of the worst dining experiences I have had in years, maybe ever!

name: T. Pugh
text: Great food with unique atmosphere and great service. Good bar for those that aren't driving. Steaks are awesome.

text: Love this place... Great food... Service is great... If you ever go ask for Julie... Shes my favorite...

The food is always enjoyable and we’ve never have poor service, quite the opposite, however, the kitchen seems to be terribly slow even with a small crowd. Four tables being served and it took 25 minutes for our appetizers. This is the norm for us and what we tell ppl. “The food is good but if you don’t have the time to wait, it’s
not a good choice.”

text: I visited Fred and Lester’s upon arriving back to Ft Benning from Iraq.  It’s atmosphere is country as corn pone which I like and the steak was superb!  Best steak in the Columbus/Phoenix City area.

text: Food was good and service so so. Took awhile to get menus, didnt have certain items on the menu, and waitress forgot one of our house salads. Took awhile for the food but it was tasty. Dont know if I would return.

name: Rachel N
text: No longer Fred n Lesters. Service was great. Food on the other hand was horrible. My husband and I both ordered steaks that came out bleeding. Sent them back. Got them again only to have to send them back a second time. By this time the steaks are burnt on the outside and still undercooked.... I woukd have rather them took their time than to "rush" so we could have our steaks with our food. "Throw the whole steak away"

name: Michael Jackson
text: Will never go back.  Service was ridiculously slow.  Waitress seemed to be trying but was not properly trained.  Waited more than an hour and was told they were out of baked potatoes.  Then later told that they were out of ribs.  Too far to drive for a poorly managed restaurant where our business is not appreciated.  Did I mention no manager came to explain or apologize?

name: Lesley Elizabeth
text: This was our 3rd time here and it's been about 2 years since our last visit. The menu has changed! No more bone in ribeye which was disappointing! We had 13 people in our party! We waited 30 minutes for our drinks as we watched 2 of the 3 girls behind the bar eat. They assigned the "new girl" to our party who was very sweet and tried very hard to please all of us and her other tables. She was not old enough to serve alcohol and the other staff definitely didn't care about her or us or the fact that we were sitting with no drinks after driving 30 minutes to visit a place we had a wonderful time previously! Of course they told us it was her first night alone after things fell apart! Then 3 others tried to help her! That added even more confusion! All of the tickets were mixed up and finally 1 male server stepped up to help her! The wait staff should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to happen! More organization is a must and a staff who's main concern is the satisfaction of ALL guests should be a priority! This experience was nowhere near as good as our first 2. The food was definitely not as good, my potato was even so burnt it was inedible. (Literally black on the bottom through the skin to the inside & as hard as the table!) And steaks that were not what we were expecting (They did have good flavor and were cooked a perfect medium rare!) After completing the payment process, we sat outside and listened to 2 guys play some live music. This was a very nice outdoor entertaining space! Completely changed for the better from our previous visit.

name: Brian Moriarity
text: Very slow service from our server. Unique location good food.

name: Michelle Boutwell
text: It's a good family place and good place to eat as well we will be having band night every Friday Night so come visit us

text: Excellent service! Great food! Reasonable priced food and steak

name: James Lowe
text: It's great beings it's not fred and Lester's anymore it is now jrs steakhouse of fort Mitchell.

name: Lydia Boll
text: I was so sad about my visit tonight. My husband and I love this place. Normally the service is wonderful. Tonight was another story. We waited almost 10 minutes to get sat. When the waitress finally came to seat us she explained that they were short staffed so there was a little bit of a wait. I understand that, I've been a waitress before. After we sat down we waited at least 30 minutes before our drink order was taken. And even then it was the owner that finally came over to take it. After that it was another 20 or so minutes before the waitress came over to take our food order. Two tables were sat almost 30 minutes after us and received their drinks right away. We sat waiting for our food to come out for another 20 minutes before our appitizers came. The waitress then said that there were no more mashed potatoes, which is what my husband and I had ordered for our sides. We asked for baked potatoes instead. They were also out of that. Ok things happen. So we decided on fries and chips instead. Not even 5 minutes later the table behind us, one of the tables who was sat 30 minutes after us, got their food. Which included both mashed potatoes and baked potatoes. Up until this point we were a little annoyed but fine, this made it much worse. We had mostly lost our appetites by this time. We mentioned to the waitress about all of this and she apologized. Nothing was done to try and rectify the situation though. I would also like to make clear the fact that it was not very busy then we got there at about 8:30 so I did not understand why everything took so long. I am disappointed because we love the food here. I'll have to think long and hard about coming back.

All I got was I'm sorry were out! no compensation for driving all the way out there (45min frive for me)for a steak wanted all I asked for was to upgrade one of toppings eather the  shrimp or crawfish topping they said sorry we can't.
The second time I went out there first thing I asked before we were even seated do you have porterhouse. The waitress stated yes! So my brother and I ordered porterhouses to be turned down five minutes later because they were out.
And they could have a good beer selection but the beers I wanted to go out of too.
I hope that the two times that I have visited this place was just bad luck but as of right now this is very poor Matt list because they didn't have anything on their menu that I wanted
I would like to give it more stars the food was good but just due to the fact that I've been there twice and they don't have the options on the menu that I like and want this is very poor with me

name: Mr Wheeler
text: I had a very nice time at the pub. The staff are attentive, and smiling. I had the smoked tuna, very delicious, i will ask for more pita chips(fried) the next time. It is served with a fire roasted tomato sauce, also very very delicious. I chose the 12oz Ribeye, Medium Well, had a bit more char than wanted, should have asked for medium. The beef is locally farmed, and was very good. I will try the shrimp and filet mignon next visit. They dont have housemade dressings anymore... hence I wont rate 5 stars. also homemade lemonade was ok.  i will return and highly recommend. You will spend about $70-80 for two without drinks, but its worth it in my opinion.  has bar area

text: Very good food!!  The service was awesome!!

name: Beverly Gillens
text: Awesome food! Great drinks! Fantastic music!

name: Kressa Peterson Sport Horses
text:
My husband and I were traveling to the Military based Spartan Race and found this restaurant online and we LOVE a good steak house. This was NOT it. We had no idea what to expect and we did read other reviews that complained about the price but we have no issue, if the service is good and the food is quality, so we headed over to Fred and Lesters. We were thrown off from the beginning. People were smoking on the front porch when we got there and when we walked in we were greeted in the fashion you would expect from folks that were very disorganized. The atmosphere is ok for a family type country establishment but it is not a date night place-by any measure. All I thought of was "based on the looks of this place, the steak must be truly amazing" . We waited for 20 minutes and no one ever even acknowledged us. We finally asked someone if we had a server and she was kind enough to get someone to help us. Not going well so far but we were happy to finally have our drinks-which sat at the bar so long that we almost went up and just grabbed them ourselves. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and they were good and the sauce for the tomatoes was tasty. We were ready to order our dinner and the waitress came and explained to us that they were out of SEVERAL of the steaks-and I think they only had a total of 5 choices. They were out of porterhouse and they were out of another one-cant remember which one. I asked her which steak she recommended and she said the filet, which was my first choice-BUT then she told me that the filet was NOT part of the quality meat that they are supposedly known for. I asked her what that meant and she said "it is basically grocery store". So I kind of chuckled and ordered the rib eye.....I really did not know how to take that but it was kind of funny. My husband ordered the ribs. My steak came with a salad and it was truly the most pathetic little limp salad I have ever received-except for maybe the few times I had a salad at waffle house. Limp lettuce and served in a thin wood bowl, like you would purchase at The Dollar Store. I could not finish it. But we were there for the steak. We continued to sit and talk and noticed that they had a patio outside where music was playing and since our food was no where to be found-It had been 45 minutes since we ordered we went out the back door to see what the patio area was like. It is a cute little area and the band seemed like they were quite talented but I was shocked that they were serving food to people while groups of other people were sitting right on the patio area smoking. I am not that particular but it was pretty gross and the smell of cigarettes was very strong the second that back door opened. I really did not think this was allowed any longer by the Health Department but maybe it is. We went back inside and had simply had enough and asked the waitress where our food was. She was sweet and smiled and said she would check and by that time I explained to her that it had been a full hour. We waited another 10 minutes with no reply from her and then told her to get our check and we would not be staying any longer. She told the manager who came by and said very quietly "Sorry about that". That was it!!! And it was a very half-a-- apology. Basically I would not return if it was FREE. My time is more valuable then to spend it at an establishment that manages itself in this manner. On a side note-the waitresses congregate around the computer screen for ever. This establishment needs to move the computer screen to an area other than the middle of the restaurant so it is not so obvious that no one knows what they are doing. I felt strong enough about it to write this review in hopes that others do not waste their time or money.

text: I am usually not one to complain considering I have been in the restaurant buisness for awhile. name: Troy Walbaum
text:
I've eaten here several times scattered about the time this place has been open.
- Service:
The service has been abysmal every time, and not due to being busy. I went one time when my party and I were the only patrons and it still took 15 minutes to get a drink order, 30 minutes to get a food order, and over an hour to get our food. I got my appetizer less than five minutes before my entree. Another person at my table got his appetizer after he got his entree. We both ordered the same appetizer that could have been prepared all at once (fried pickles).
- Food:
It's not that good. I've tried a variety of things. The oysters are about like any other oyster place. Everything else is either okay or not good. Being too salty seems to be a common thread. Absolutely not worth the wait.
- Price:
A bit on the expensive side for this kind of place.
- Bar:
The only redeeming feature. It's poorly stocked, but has a good atmosphere.
- Overall:
I simply don't come here anymore unless I'm meeting people, and even then I'll try to convince them to go somewhere else. The only exception is the bar. I don't mind the bar. But food-wise? Absolutely not. Luckily, most people have realized the only thing worse than the food is the service, so I don't have to convince people to meet somewhere else much anymore.

name: Thomas Hutchins
text: Food was good and service was good. We had a decent sized group and only one thing got messed up. I have to say, I didn't expect it to be as good as it was.

name: Brian Parsons
text: This is definitely not the Dirty Pearl of old. Change in management has brought the Pearl to a screeching halt. From poorly prepared plates to slow, inattentive service, this restaurant ranks at the bottom of my list. On 12/23/2017 my wife and I got served poor oysters, oil logged fries, and a $71.00 bill to boot. The waitress was doubling as help in the kitchen and was out of communication most of the meal. Dinners beware! You will pay for what you'd wish you'd get, get what you'd never want to eat and made to do all, alone as they will not even hold your hand to make it all the more palatable.

name: Kim Reynolds
text: WOW!  fantastic food and service to boot!  The oysters were huge and so good.  I had the Maui platter blackened and fantastic!!!  If you are in the Troy, AL area this is a MUST!

name: Denver Harris
text: Always have a good experience. Their gm Chase is always polite and friendly. Definitely recommend coming here

name: Tammy Barganier
text: I had a wonderful time, the service was great, and I loved seeing Christy again. I will be back. The best of luck to your new adventure. You will be the best.

name: greg derzis
text: Good place for drinks and dinner, and for watching the games. Friendly staff, and good food

name: Jeremy McKenzie
text: Food is just ok, service usually isn't good. The good staff seems to leave after a month or so.

name: Hope Richardson
text: My oysters came out cold. Service was terrible . the only good thing was the cold beer.

name: Christopher Bill
text: Rustic bar with good food. Pretty loud, but not too bad. Vegetarian options limited.

name: paul long
text:
Service was great , hambuger steak was
Just awesome ,they have great oysters most any way u like ,i like them raw !! ☺😊😃 thanks paul long

name: Donny Bailey
text: Great place! Oysters are tasty and folks are real, beers are cold.

name: Stephanie Redmond
text: The fryer wasn't working and i ask for lettuce and pickles and mustard on my burger and didn't get it plus they gave me sour cream when i ask for butter for my baked potato to top it off verry slow but the food was good.it took about an hour to get my food.

name: Larry Patti Dwyer
text: Pretty slow service. Mediocre at most. Wouldn't repeat

name: Chris Green
text: Drive to Dothan, Same price better food

name: Chase Wingard
text: The deals that they have Tuesday nights are excellent to end the day right

name: Chip Kelley
text: Friendly service tasty food very pleased!

name: James Estes
text: Food wasn't great, staff was nice though.

name: Chris Davis
text: The shrimp and grits in cake form is awesome.  Recommend.

name: Chrome “chromeguru” Guru
text: The food and service I received was good. .

name: Patricia Eiland
text: Ran out of oysters how you go do that when that's what it's all about LOL

name: Lisa Oliver
text: Walked right out

name: FRANK FANIEL
text: It's a great place to enjoy

name: Shirley Drosyk
text: The lemon pepper wings are awesome

name: Mauricca “Sunblossom” Bruner
text: going soon

name: Regina Ham
text: Having to order before seating is not for me.

name: Jimmy R Tuck
text: Way to expensive for what they serve

name: Nancy Norton
text: Best shrimp & grits anywhere!!!

name: Cashmere Jones
text: The oyster are really fresh

name: Will Gray
text: Ask for Nikki

name: Sara Garcia
text: The food is really good and their margaritas are the best.

name: Lawanda Richardson
text: The food is great ..

name: Rusty Newton
text:
My wife and I ate here for a late dinner around 10:30pm. We were quickly seated by our friendly host and waitress Kim. We had a mudslide and the herbivore. Both arrived at the table promptly and the pizza was particularly impressive. Tons of toppings, very fresh and hot. The toppings were balanced and the thin crust was very crispy just like we wanted.

Overall only a positive experience with no complaints. Kim was good to us and when we come again we'll try to find her!

name: Joe Anderson
text: We were disappointed in the service we received during our last visit.  We ordered two pizzas.  Apparently there was an issue with one of the pizzas and it had to be re-made.  I appreciate that the staff corrected whatever the issue was.  However, they held the “good” pizza and when it came out it was cold.  The waitress recognized the issue without us saying anything and had that pizza replaced.  Again I appreciate that the staff took care of the second issue but we ended up having to wait an extreme amount of time for all us to be able to finish our meal.  Although both pizzas were good it took entirely too long for us to receive or order in a correct fashion.  Given the price and it taking multiple attempts to provide the correct product it was quite disappointing.

name: Andres Sulleiro
text: Good pizza. Italian sausage is crumbly, my preference, and not in big chunks like other places. Reminds me of many Midwestern joints. Standard dough is hand tossed, though more of a fork and knife kind of affair. Gluten free dough was excellent according to my wife who said "I'm a little concerned that it isn't actually gluten free it's so good!" Do not care for all the TV's in the place, as a family restaurant, everyone kept getting distracted instead of talking to each other. Solid place.

name: Brenda Cooper
text: Good pizza, I enjoy the food, prices are a little high but its worth it for a special treat for the kids.  We have had great service and the food is cooked in the amount of time you would think for a pizza so the wait is not bad.  This is probably my favorite pizza place in the Madison area...

name: myron cooper
text: We had 62 people and a nice simple setup. One appetizer table with two kinds of mussels and sliders. Beer and wine included - hard stuff extra. One antipasto table and they brought around some others stuff like crab balls and fried zucchini flowers. Special treat was pignoli cookies for dessert.

name: Robert Weeks
text: Cool looking place.  Comfortable atmosphere.   Breadsticks are the bomb.  Firecracker penne was excellent.   Alfredo sauce was bland but could have been an off day.  Apple stack dessert should be illegal!  Service, cleanliness,  10 out of 10.  Really good beer selection.   Ask for Matt.

name: Brian Gibson
text:
Great food and one of the few places in Huntsville / Madison with decent service. The only time we've had an issue with service, the waitress thought we were waiting on another person. She apologized multiple times and did a great job after that. Pretty good beer selection also. Decent placement of TV's so you can watch a lot of different sports but they are pretty high on the wall for viewing. However, a lot of people like to bring their kids there, so be aware it can get pretty loud.

Overall, one of our favorite places to eat.

name: Jayne Hopkins
text: Great service and wonderful pizza! I will go here again even though it was a longer than usual drive. Well worth it.

name: HK NoLabelxxCrew LGBTQ
text: The food is great and you can taste the freshness, but the wait was wayy too long ..I literally went to sleep and woke up and my food still wasn't there. Plus, it was freeezing cold in there. Next time, I'll definitely have to sit outside. The prices are reasonable also. Definitely a repeat restaurant choice.

name: James Liebbe
text: Good service for our party of 30. Calzone was delicious. Spinach salad was great.  Price was a little high.

name: Stephanie Friend
text: Decided, after a previous bad experience, giving them one more try. Needless to say, we were disappointed yet again. Waited about 10 mins for server. Although she was friendly and apologetic food took a while. We ordered wings and a salad. Both fell short of expectations. Left very upset to have spent the amount of money we did on the low quality.

name: William Aguaouz
text: Pizza was Great! Server was great only complaint was my drink wasn't that good but I'll definitely be back I'll just try a different drink

name: Colin White
text: Don't plan to eat here again. The food is really pricey and I don't find the taste to be any better than other local pizza places. The wait times are horrible for your food.

name: jessica barnes
text: Freaking awesome pizza. The spicy mexicali is the best. We drive from Florence just for the deliciousness.

name: James Branch
text: Great Pizza, good wings (boneless and bone-in). Service is hit or miss and prices are high. Will be back to try again.

name: David Cooper
text: Plenty of TVs , food moderately priced and good service

name: John Griffith
text: Great pizza & wings, good service, fair price.

name: Baylie Bacon
text: Worst service in my life. We ordered the focaccia and oil and herb dipping sauce as our appetizer, the bread was stale and the sauce wasn't your standard dipping oil, but oil and balsamic dressing? We ordered a large cheese pizza which was stated on the menu at $14.99, yet somehow our total was $34.00 (we had the appetizer removed from our total). When we asked how our total could be so high, she explained that our extra cheese and basil toppings somehow costed over $10? Our server never checked on us and when we asked questions she seemed annoyed and was very unhelpful. Definitely will not be returning. Wouldn't ever reccomend to anyone.

name: Eric Ibarra
text: If you want both pizza and craft beer then this is the place to go. They have a large selection of both pizza and beer, which are both good.

name: Jeremy Abbott
text: The service is horrible. After 20 minutes of no one even taking our drink order we left. I could understand if the place was busy, but there were only 3 others there.

name: Stephen Trumbull
text: Nice place. Tasty food and great revolving beer selection.

name: Manwe Elder
text:
There's a reason the people who work here come and go. My suspicion is that what plagues this place is something persistent throughout the entire establishment, the diseased service and hit-and-miss food being no mere coincidence.

I pity not only those unfortunate souls who have had to be subject to perhaps one of the worst dining experiences possible but also the workers themselves, who while contributing to the unpleasant atmosphere, very likely are only unpleasant because of a major flaw in management somehwere high up.

My family and I have devised a game in which we bet on what odd creation our simple spiral breadstick, which we have periodically ordered on our rare visits to Pie In the Sky, will be each time around. Everytime we are surprised with something new.

Why do we still go every couple of months despite the awareness that the service and good will likely suck major donkey piss? Because Pie In the Sky has the potential to serve out awesome tasting food. The sad thing is that bad management and simple carelessness make such an occurence an outlier among the general spread of crappy visits. It has likely gotten to the point that we'll just not go anymore, whatever faint hope we had having been demolished by the consequetive iniquities of Pie In the Sky.

name: Ross Cherry
text: $12 kids pizza? Ok maybe if the pizza was that good then i could live with that but Ive had better pizza from a gas station...very dissapointed not worth the money and you can get better quality from Dominos

name: Joe McIntosh
text: Great food, friendly service, and excellent beer selection.

name: Matt Bynum
text: Best pizza west of Huntsville. Try the Baja Chicken!

name: Jason Moore
text: Service was non-existent.  We sat at the table for 10 minutes wondering if anyone was working.  There was no one on duty when we walked in on a Saturday at 1pm.  There was a group of 15 cheerleaders up front who waited for 25 minutes before finally seating themselves.  After looking at the menu, I'm guessing it is run-of-the-mill Mall Sprawl food.  We went to Sam & Greggs where someone says "Hello..." when you walk in the door.

name: Ryan Lavender
text: Perfect food and location. Wish there were more of these restaurants around.

name: Mikey P
text: Awesome atmosphere and great selection!

name: Jonathan Mack
text: Not a great value

name: Kevin Pulliam
text: Great beer, above average calzones

name: Justin Grissim
text: Sat for 20 minutes and never even got water. We left

name: Christine Chaloupka
text: Parker was excellent! !!!

name: Tiffany F
text: Cool

name: Tony Goemaat
text:
Great burgers and amazing appetizers.  They have 102 beers on tap which includes cider, and seltzer.
Come try some good stuff and hope they don't run out of anything

name: Rob Landtiser
text: Great choice of beers, 102 to choose from. Even had 7 different cidah choices. Had lunch with outstanding salads. Visited 5 years previous for a conference and nothing has changed. Great atmosphere to sit and enjoy a beverage.

name: Tim K
text: Good place for beer, they need help! They need more workers. Food looked good but came out luke warm. Beer was great! If you like emo music, this is your place!!!

name: Maya kast
text:
Large large large variety of bears. All what we took was really tasty. The pretzels was delicious with beer cheese dip is a very large and comforting dish. The salads are ok.

We set outside, very good atmosphere and nice street view.

name: Kerprenia White
text: Second time trying them. Never again, service is horrible. I walked and was told to sit where ever, we took our seats and no one came to greet us or take drinks at less. A couple who walked in before us, had their order taken and water, yet we were still waiting. Just to be told their in the middle of a shift change.

name: Carl Vervisch
text: Great food, great beer selection, great service. We stopped by on our way from central Louisiana to Florida and sat down for a delicious meal and some fine local ales. The server did an excellent job recommending beer to the two of us (somewhat beer connoisseurs) and I enjoyed an amazing juicy IPA from Parish, Louisiana. The decor was really fun; we spent a good while taking in all the vintage steins on the wall. Great spot and one I would gladly return to on a future trip through this area.

name: Steven Volbrecht
text: Great patio experience here. The food was delicious and the tap list is quite impressive! Plenty of choices for food and over 100 beers to choose from. Would definitely recommend a visit if visiting downtown!

name: Andreas
text:
We arrived in Mobile at Thanksgiving in the late afternoon. We walked through the streets and tried to find a restaurant. This was not easy. We heard loud music an found Loda Bier Garten.

We stepped in and Nikki welcomed us.
She recommended us two tasty beer (from hundreds). Our two dishes were very delicious. Especially my burger was absolutely fantastic. Honestly the best I ever had. Really awesome 👏

Thanks @ Nikki for your good recommendations and your kind and friendly service 🙏

name: Margaret Harper
text: Funky little bar with a lot of atmosphere.  Clean, friendly, and tasty food. Not german, but definitely a lot of beer.

name: Leidi Chavez
text: Located in the heart of downtown Mobile, AL. There is plenty of outdoor and indoor seating. They have a huge beer selection which is very cool, but 2 of the ones I wanted to try were unavailable at that time. Burger was very good. And my server was very nice and attentive.

name: Anna Casteen
text: After trying to go to a brewery and leaving when the bartenders weren’t wearing masks, we walked to Loda, and I couldn’t be happier we ended up here.  We had the fried pickles, a salad, and wings, as well as several different stouts, and everything was wonderful. Our waitress Angel was perfect, she embodied her name and was attentive and patient in spite of it being busy.  10/10 would recommend.  The picture is my “You gotta horchata” and it was amazing.

name: Hermine Peterson
text: I guarantee you will find something you like. Located downtown, it's in a great location to relax and take in the downtown action. Their food is also excellent, with some unique twists to your normal pub fare. Our waiter Cameron was amazing. He was very knowledgable of their beer menu and offered insight on his recommendations.

name: FEMI Magazine
text: Great Food! I love the wings here! Be sure to try the Korean sauce flavored wings and the Root Beer glazed wings are good also but be mindful they come with a spicy kick!

name: Tom Kelly
text: Excellent food & location in downtown Mobile. Had the Spanish Fort burger - exceptional! Other than the spotty service, definitely worth revisiting.

name: Robert Evans
text: Food was good. Service was so bad we will never return. Only one of our tables 4 orders were correct. My order took 20 minutes to half way correct. The onion rings they left off arrived when they brought our check at the end of the meal with "I am  sorry these took so long" but not sorry enough to remove them from the bill. The waitress also never refilled our drinks even after we asked. Whole experience took 90 minutes when it should have taken at most 45mins to 60mins.

name: Malcolm Banks
text: Been here three times and tonight was just as good. They had an issue where my ticket got lost during the shift change but they fixed it by comping my meal for the error. Even with that they still get all 5 stars from me because the food is always amazing as well as the customer service!

name: Christopher Anglin
text: Nikki and Brantley are the reason I visit! The service is always good and I feel welcomed every time. Food is hot and fresh. Korean BBQ is delicious here on the wings.

name: michael zepp
text: Stumbled upon this place with my buddy. He said I had to have one of their burgers...and boy was he right!! I had the Sanger burger..the portobello mushroom on this is just as big as the burger!!! The meat had to have been fresh ground right before it was cooked, because I’ve never had a burger that juicy!! And their home cut fries are some of the best I’ve had. I can’t wait to take my family there!!!

name: Judy Jones
text: The burger meat was very good.  However,  I was expecting more from the overall burger.  I had the waffle burger,  frozen waffles.   The egg was cooked perfectly.  The onion rings were delicious,  but the mac and cheese teaste like box.

name: Karen Peacock
text: We enjoyed our visit ...  really neat N.O. style pub...  all kinds of beer to try.  We ordered fried pickles which were very tasty.   They had all kinds of hamburgers and other sandwiches.  I got a Loda Burger and my hubby ordered the Seared Tuna BLT which we liked pretty good...  will try something different on our next trip.  Our waiter, a young guy (didn't get his name, but was friendly and provided great service!

name: andrew marks
text: This was my favorite place to go for German Bier because they had what I wanted and it always tasted just right. Yesterday they didn’t have what I wanted and the two beers I ordered, a Kolsch and a Bitburger, tasted sour. I tried to explain that to our waiter but he didn’t believe me.  I have been drinking German Bier for over 40 years and if it tastes bad it’s because the lines are dirty or the rinse water for the glasses is dirty. It’s a shame to see a good bar go down hill.

name: Terry Robar
text: Downtown Mobile on weekday night for dinner. Burgers with different toppings... ours were good and tasty. Large TV's so can see what is on from any seat. Wait staff was attentive , not klingy. Out of the one beer (in a bottle) we ordered from their 15x12" page of brews offered

name: Dustin Dowdy
text: Great meal. Some of the best fried pickles I've ever had. Would be 5 stars if they hadn't been out of ranch dressing.

name: Cornelia Thrash
text: Outside dining was great! The fish was horrible. Didn't know it would be fish sticks! They should offer a children's menu with the fish sticks on it. That way you would have some idea. The Shroomz were delicious! Waitress was amazing!

name: Don Price
text:
Was told this place had a great German beer selection (when I called ahead) and they didn't.
My food was under cooked and my wife's was greasy.
Don't think we will go back.

name: Chris Sours
text: Great food, very busy, even on a Monday.  Don't plan a quick visit though, last 2 times I've ordered to go, it took over 30 minutes each time.

name: Bruce Fox
text:
Terribly, terribly slow service. The place wasn't that busy but the server just didn't act too interested in providing timely service. It took forever to get drinks and food to the table and i was a party of 1!  The food wasn't that great when it did arrive - it was just ok.
I won't be back.

name: Vic Stahl
text: Bartender FORGOT my drink order, then FORGOT to enter my food order! A bowl of chili (should take 5 seconds)...chili finally came...with a cheap teaspoon...no crackers in the place. SAVE YOUR MONEY! Cuz their prices will separate it from you fast!...actually slow :-/

name: Darren Shay
text: Seated ourselves, bartender and waiter ignored us or appeared to have an attitude, waiter was high as hell and we could tell because he sat down at our table when he first finally came to us, hardly ever spoke a word to us while I tried multiple times to engage him and use manners. Asked for the check before we were even done so we could go down the block to a different bar.

name: Brent Barnes
text: The place had lots of potential and the food looked great. However, the customer service wasn't good so I decided not to order anything and just walked from my table to the bar and got my own drinks after waiting for so long.

name: deb from Travel Mobile
text: Went to eat ordered pretzel bombs the pork Jager schnitzel with red cabbage and potato salad. First the girl says they are out of pretzel bombs and then we can't order the red cabbage to choose another side and then she come back and says they no longer carry the Jager schnitzel but yet all of the items are still featured on the menu. So my son and his friend left(they had ordered a water and diet coke) myself and my husband stayed and ate and when we got the bill they even charged us for my sons diet coke that he didn't drink because they had no items he ordered.

name: Bradley Lemma
text: The best burger so juicy!  So many beers it's insane selection of sours and ipas is on point.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable a great stop on our trip through the south!  Great job guys!

name: D & H Concrete Construction LLC
text: AMAZING FOOD!!!!!🤤🤤🤤 Ordering was the hardest decision I have ever made in my life! I wanted EVERYTHING!! I ordered 3 different burgers just for me bc I couldn't decide  and if they hadn't been out of so many things I would've ordered more!

name: Grand Bay City Girl
text: Was a great dinner. Food was great. And thanks to the waiter Shane, the evening ended up  flawless.

name: Gabrielle Jurgens
text: Best burgers! Best ahi tuna, fresh delicious salad, fresh ranch dressing.

name: Rickie Garcia
text: Stick with the APPS! This was the tale of two courses. The appetizers were definitely the highlight of our lunch here.  The boneless wings were on point, the pretzel bites were amazing, spinach artichoke dip tasted as good as mine and the dumplings were outrageous! The mac attack burger was lacking, the waffles on the chicken and waffle sandwich didn't stop steeping oil and the Spanish Fort Burger was meh.  SO back to my original statement, stick to the apps and you will go away happy.

name: Nice tik toks you have
text:
We ate here for lunch on a Sunday while we were visiting Mobile. We didn’t have to wait for a table and were able to sit down right away. They do have communal sitting if you aren’t with a group big enough to fill a table.
We were super excited about the beer and wanted to order a flight but were told they don’t do those on weekends after we tried to order one. I feel like this should be posted somewhere on the menu.
We tried to order several appetizers and they were out of a lot of them because it was Sunday and the waiter said they were consistently out of food after the weekend. I feel like if this is a big enough problem where your staff knows it’s every weekend then it could be addressed in the kitchen.
We tried the Funkdified Fried Brie, the big pretzel, the Dirty Bird chicken sandwich, the chicken and waffle sandwich, the chili chili bang bang burger, and the seared tuna blt, also the fish and chips. All of our food came with sauces on the side and they were amazing. The ranch is the best I’ve had anywhere. The Slap Yo Mama sauce that comes with the Dirty Bird chicken sandwich was really good. The beer cheese for the pretzel was divine. That’s about as good as it got though. The food was all very just ok.  I would not recommend the Mac and cheese.
The beer selection was fabulous! If you are considering going here these are my tips: this is very much a “I’m drinking and need food at 1am” place. We tried to bring our kids and while it’s family friendly during the day it’s CRAMPED in there. It’s a bar so don’t think of it like a regular restaurant. I would love to go back if I ever just want a really good draft beer!

name: Samuel Clemens IV
text: Travis was great! He had amazing recommendations with brew. Clean beer lines, and tasty food. We'll definitely be back.

name: Chris Bolton
text: The food is great and the server Angel is the absolute best I just love her to pieces. Also an amazing selection of draft beer and the rest of the staff is pretty cool too. Except that Henry guy he's like really cool.

name: Brandon Spence
text: Great food and beer, with some dishes I would never have expected at a bar. We had fried brie with blueberry glaze and pretzel bites as an appetizer. Then I had Jeagerschnitzel with german potato salad and pickled red cabbage. Everything was excellent including the service. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. Drop by if you are in the area.

name: Daniel Mitchell
text: Quality of the food good, it isn’t anything absolutely amazing or a “must hit spot” in Mobile but there’s definitely a lot worse in the city. Atmosphere is good and wasn’t overly busy when I visited. Great staff and attention!

name: James Quint
text: Good food, but they are always out of half of the menu. They don't seem to be willing to pay enough to keep the restaurant staffed.

resp.text: Hey James, both the issues you mentioned here are issues that restaurants are struggling with nationally. There are many production and delivery issues with certain food items and an employee shortage as a result of the pandemic. We are working as hard as we can to overcome these unavoidable obstacles. We thank you for your patience and understanding.

name: Idiana Clausell
text: Burger was cold and they got our order wrong. Beer on tap had a strange flavor like moldy. Not impressed at all.

name: Potato Basket
text: I cannot comment on the service of this place nor the food as I was treated poorly before I could even enter the building and immediately lost interest. Flaming numale staff manning the door and rudely turning away interested customers for not wearing a mask, yet not even two feet inside the restaurant and beyond it is easily visible that no one is wearing a mask. What is the point of requiring a mask if it can be removed immediately upon entry? Being rude to people before they even have a chance to get inside the building and spend money is unfathomably stupid from a business standpoint. We ended up spending our money elsewhere down the street.

name: Cloey Robertson
text: This place was good, but not great. We ordered an appetizer of Shroomz, which was pretty good. The batter was lacking seasoning, but the cook was good. My fiancé got the Hugh Jass Waffle Burger, which was delicious. He got it with chicken, which complimented the syrup and waffle better than beef would, I think. I got the Chili Chili Bang Bang Burger. The patty was cooked perfectly and delicious, but the burger just had a bit too much going on. I feel like the black beans overshadowed the patty, and the onion ring also got a bit lost in all the flavors.

name: Daphne Ellis-Floyd
text: Incredible food and excellent service! The atmosphere was fun and relaxed. Unique burgers and more - a MUST TRY.

name: Brian Jackson
text: Schnitzel was ok. Ordered fried brie out of it. Ordered pretzel out. Mother-in-law ordered beer from menu bartender yelling from behind bar  they where out of it and did not suggest a beer that would match it. Could not understand beer menu. Asked Waitress if they had dark German beer she said she did not know and didn't even ask bartender. Had to put empty beer glass front of table for refill.  Waitress did not show us attention. When I finally received bill she did not even thank me or look at me. She tossed the bill on the table and walked off. Don't  know why ,after all of this I still left a 20% tip. Will not be back.

name: Charley Cormier
text: I will reserve reviews for this year. The overall experience and food was great.

name: Bradley Lemma
text: The best burger so juicy!  So many beers it's insane selection of sours and ipas is on point.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable a great stop on our trip through the south!  Great job guys!

name: Samuel Clemens IV
text: Travis was great! He had amazing recommendations with brew. Clean beer lines, and tasty food. We'll definitely be back.

name: Brent Barnes
text: The place had lots of potential and the food looked great. However, the customer service wasn't good so I decided not to order anything and just walked from my table to the bar and got my own drinks after waiting for so long.

name: Dixie Dixon
text: We ate here on New Years Eve, the staff was very nice but they seemed overwhelmed with the crowd. We had to ask for a menu, ask for drinks and flag down a waiter to place our order. We ordered the Ahi tuna Poke for an appetizer which was delicious, then we ordered wings in 3 flavors and a blue cheese burger cut in half. The wings were very good, the burger however was horrible. It was cooked perfectly but inedible, it taste like someone dumped perfume on it. It's so hard to describe, like Grandmas perfume in food form, 3 people tried it and everyone spit it out, we told the waiter and he took it back but we never got the issue resolved and we ended up paying for the burger. Would we go back? Sure the staff was nice the atmosphere was nice and 2 out of 3 of our food items were perfect. Not sure what happened to that burger but I'm summing it up to a bad night because of the crowds.

name: Daniel Mitchell
text: Quality of the food good, it isn’t anything absolutely amazing or a “must hit spot” in Mobile but there’s definitely a lot worse in the city. Atmosphere is good and wasn’t overly busy when I visited. Great staff and attention!

name: Chris Bolton
text: The food is great and the server Angel is the absolute best I just love her to pieces. Also an amazing selection of draft beer and the rest of the staff is pretty cool too. Except that Henry guy he's like really cool.

name: Paul Vingiello
text: Great place for exploring new brews!  It was also a nice place to duck into and get out of the crowded parade scene for a bite.  The burgers were large and flavorful.   The fried sausage on a stick was nice as well.  While it was not amazing food, it was a lot nicer than I had expected from a beer joint!  The doughnut ice cream sandwich was also a nice treat.

name: Brandon Spence
text: Great food and beer, with some dishes I would never have expected at a bar. We had fried brie with blueberry glaze and pretzel bites as an appetizer. Then I had Jeagerschnitzel with german potato salad and pickled red cabbage. Everything was excellent including the service. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. Drop by if you are in the area.

name: Potato Basket
text: I cannot comment on the service of this place nor the food as I was treated poorly before I could even enter the building and immediately lost interest. Flaming numale staff manning the door and rudely turning away interested customers for not wearing a mask, yet not even two feet inside the restaurant and beyond it is easily visible that no one is wearing a mask. What is the point of requiring a mask if it can be removed immediately upon entry? Being rude to people before they even have a chance to get inside the building and spend money is unfathomably stupid from a business standpoint. We ended up spending our money elsewhere down the street.

name: Cloey Robertson
text: This place was good, but not great. We ordered an appetizer of Shroomz, which was pretty good. The batter was lacking seasoning, but the cook was good. My fiancé got the Hugh Jass Waffle Burger, which was delicious. He got it with chicken, which complimented the syrup and waffle better than beef would, I think. I got the Chili Chili Bang Bang Burger. The patty was cooked perfectly and delicious, but the burger just had a bit too much going on. I feel like the black beans overshadowed the patty, and the onion ring also got a bit lost in all the flavors.

name: Brian Jackson
text: Schnitzel was ok. Ordered fried brie out of it. Ordered pretzel out. Mother-in-law ordered beer from menu bartender yelling from behind bar  they where out of it and did not suggest a beer that would match it. Could not understand beer menu. Asked Waitress if they had dark German beer she said she did not know and didn't even ask bartender. Had to put empty beer glass front of table for refill.  Waitress did not show us attention. When I finally received bill she did not even thank me or look at me. She tossed the bill on the table and walked off. Don't  know why ,after all of this I still left a 20% tip. Will not be back.

name: Daphne Ellis-Floyd
text: Incredible food and excellent service! The atmosphere was fun and relaxed. Unique burgers and more - a MUST TRY.

name: Idiana Clausell
text: Burger was cold and they got our order wrong. Beer on tap had a strange flavor like moldy. Not impressed at all.

name: Braden Urban
text: The only reason this isn’t a 1 star review is the beer selection. Had masks on, walked to the bar and sat down. We took our masks off once we were seated, but the bartender/manager insisted that he see we had masks before he would give us menus. Multiple other couples entered after us not wearing a mask, and were never talked to. When I asked the manager why he harassed the two of us, he just said “well look at them. You can tell they have masks” and walked away.

name: James Quint
text: Good food, but they are always out of half of the menu. They don't seem to be willing to pay enough to keep the restaurant staffed.

resp.text: Hey James, both the issues you mentioned here are issues that restaurants are struggling with nationally. There are many production and delivery issues with certain food items and an employee shortage as a result of the pandemic. We are working as hard as we can to overcome these unavoidable obstacles. We thank you for your patience and understanding.

name: Michael Abrams
text: Pretty friendly place in the heart of downtown Mobile.  Above average fare and very nice fish and chips

name: Charley Cormier
text: I will reserve reviews for this year. The overall experience and food was great.

name: Lindsey Underwood
text: Amazing service, kind and helpful staff, chill atmosphere, LGBTQIA friendly, fantastic food. Love going here anytime in in Mobile!

name: Alabama Lucey
text: Disappointed they didn't have any Buffalo Dip today but I was still able to enjoy the Chilli (something) Burger.  I love the heat of it and the jalapeños add great flavor! We went for lunch and they were very busy.  Only 1 4+ person table available.  Employees were all great.

name: Guy Llewellyn
text: Typically the staff here is welcoming and I experience good if not great service. this has changed markedly in the past few weeks with the addition of a new bartender with purple/pink hair. i have observed multiple service breakdowns and rather unfriendly tone of voice and choice of words. This person neglected a guest and myself for 10 minutes while arguing with coworkers. yelled at somebody for not wearing a mask then hit her vape and blew exhaust all over behind the bar, returning the mask to her mouth but not her nose. Everybody has a bad day now and then. apparently she has one every day. Somebody needs to contact the owner about this-its hurting business long term and short. Used to be employees here smiled. They don't seem to smile when this person is working.

resp.text:
Hello Mr Llewelyn,
Would you mind sending an email to Matt@lodabeer.com with these details? Please also include the date and approximate time of this incident. We absolutely want to address this immediately. Thank you for taking the time to provide this feedback and we hope to hear from you soon.

name: Dockside RV Resort Coden Alabama
text: Really good and a very generous portion of food. When in Mobile put it on your list of places to dine. Great food and great service.

name: Tia Williams
text: If this wasn’t the best burger I’ve ever had in my life, it surely was close. Everything about this burger was good... the patty was seasoned to absolute perfection!!! This was my first time ever having fries like this but they were soooooooo good! The fish was good and the tarter sauce was one of the best I’ve ever had. The southwestern egg rolls were yummy as well. I wish they had this restaurant in Atlanta because I know for a fact I would go often!! Well done guys!

name: Michael Tonner
text: Unbelievable selection of beer.  Fannnnntastic music.  Amazing staff.  Win all around.

name: Jerry Persons
text: Visited the weekend of festival of flowers, had 10 family members with us , 5 years old to 74 years old, the staff was top notch , handled our two tables like it was nothing , FOOD IS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!!!

name: Emmanuel Martinez
text: Th staff was very friendly and  very attentive. The food quality was outstanding, I had a Sacre Bleu Hamburger, totally recommended without any kind of sauce it tasted just delicious and it was very juicy and the meat was very well seasoned. The dessert was very big and big enough to be shared by my wife and me. At the end I wanted a cup of coffee, they didn't have it in the menu but the waiter offered to brew some for me. Kudos to all the staff!

name: Zayda Lopez
text: Main dishes were good and so was the beer. I’m taking a star away because the pretzel appetizer is more like a chunk of bread, and it took quite a bit of time for our food to get to our table.

name: Brian Cobb
text: Probably the best place for burgers in Mobile regarding variety and creativeness. Also probably the largest tap selection in Mobile too. Perfect for a meal or drinks. Lively atmosphere and later in the evening not exactly kid friendly especially on weekends. But fine for kids early evening.  Great spot for a meal or beer during Art Walk!

name: Billie Gibson
text: Beware this place closes 3 hours early. Well they did tonight. Need to update there times and very rude staff I was just on the phone with. I tried calling earlier to see what time they closed and no answer called at 9 and they are telling me they are already closed. Bad customer service

name: Alec Bauman
text: The food and beer here are great. Don't expect German food, though they do have one jagerschitzel dish.

name: Cody Simonton
text: Delicious food, awesome beer list, great environment. Dirty bird sandwich and a double IPA for me today. This is the spot!

name: Allison Libby-Thesing
text: We wanted some craft beer for dinner and needed to eat. We found a great brewery with outdoor seating and a wide selection of beer choices. We started out with the fried Brie, definitely worth a try. The flavor combos with the jelly and pretzel bites were great. My husband ordered the Beinville burger and I ordered the tuna stacks. I planned on the salad but ended up with a sandwich.  Our server was really nice and apologized for the mistake and offered to get the right meal, I declined. The tuna and burger were both fantastic. The beers we had were good, overall we would be sure to go back again.

name: Rich B
text: Service was not very good from the girls working the bar. I suppose it's hard to find anyone that wants to work anymore though.

name: Larry H
text: The burgers are sooooooo dam good! Oh get the fried pickles! They are like pickle chips

name: Brandy Liles
text:
This place was AMAZING!
We will definitely br back!
Highly recommend the mac-n-cheese balls app, thee Cajun burger, and the waffle burger!

name: Buckridge Noble
text: I had a great experience here! Decided to order some wings to go and enjoyed a draft beer while I waited! They have a huge variety of beer on draft and the wings were amaaazing!!! If I go back I'll be trying a burger because they looked and smelled delicious! Highly recommend.

name: Barbara A Moore
text: Very good food, plentiful too.

name: M Nielsen
text: Good food, really good beer, definitely worth stopping by.

name: Samantha Foxx
text: Limited on the cocktails they make but food is good

name: Bill Kuch
text: Fantastic hamburger.  Only issue was it was extremely cold in the room.

name: James Bernard
text: Southwest egg rolls were really good.. the chili is excellent

name: Tom Whitesell
text: Awesome place!  Food and beer was outstanding.

name: Brandon Jenkins
text: Don't eat here unless your drunk and they're no other options. Even then think twice.

name: Jessica Wolford
text: Awesome little place. Great outside seating area. We didnt try the food yet but the service was great and good beer selection.  Nikki was awesome!

name: Trent Tobolski
text: Great beer selection, food, and service! Randomly stopped while traveling for work and would recommend

name: Cory Griffin
text: Nice spot for German beer food... great beer selection and awesome staff will be back soon!

name: Amir Atp
text: They don’t care about the customers. I waited for a long time but no body took care of us.

name: Holly Hughes
text: Incredible beer selection, inventive menu with interesting twist on classic pub fare in addition to southern staples.  Sugar Rush burger was a delicious one of a kind meal.

name: Debi Allen
text: This place was the best hamburger I've ever eaten in my whole life I had the quarter pounder with cheese I think it was called it had macaroni and cheese on it was so good the staff was wonderful definitely recommend this place

name: Michael Small
text: Good place to eat and have a be beer.

name: Alisa Loyd
text: Mighty Tasty and great service too!!

name: Michael Bartz
text: Great food and plenty to go around! Definitely recommend checking out

name: Edward Stratton
text:
So.... This hybrid bar/restaurant is a little gem in Mobile Alabama that if not for a friend of mine, I never would have found them .

I'm not really a big drinker , but my friend enjoys quality beer and invited me there with him one evening and let me say, their beers are incredibly fresh and amazing !!!

I think the company has something like over 100 on tap? It's insane .

Moreover, their food is actually quality stuff !!! Huge portions, great flavors, amazing price .

Do yourself a favor and go check them out ! Just know, they definitely get busy at times and it take a little while to get your food.

Keep of the great work Loda!

name: I. Oriakhi
text: Awful service don’t waste ur time or money with these  people

name: J B
text:
Now I just adore this place. I've been there a couple times when visiting from Canada and I have made some great memories there. The burgers and other food are great--pub fare, but generally better quality. The list of beers, ales, and meads is just incredible and the location is great. I've found the service to be friendly and kind, and attentive even when the place is packed.
I can't imagine ever visiting Mobile and not going here. It's one of my favorite stops in the region.

name: Joseph Hebert
text: Omg the burgers were great. The mac and cheese is to die for as well. The french fries are the best I ever had as well. Amazing. I keep going back for more medium cooked is the best way to eat it.

name: just J
text: I love burgers and they have the best!

name: Drue Knowles
text: Amazing!! HUGE beer selection, great burgers, awesome service.

name: Gretchen
text:
Very disappointing.
Except for the black red gold colors outside there is nothing German about this establishment.  The decor is dated, full of kitschy Budweiser beersteins,(not even German steins) torn seats and sticky tables. The waitstaff was pushy, constantly trying to give beer samples that we didn't want.
Food was not as listed on the menu,  no house made fries or brioche buns. And was really disappointing.  Couldn't eat more than few bites of any of it.  I won't even get into how far from authentic anything was! Just gross.
Pricy tab, not worth it!
We'll skip this place in the future.

name: Mike Mitch
text: Tara was awesome!! The chicken and waffles were fantastic. Thank you for a great experience

name: Jordan Scott
text: Really good service and food selection

name: Susan Peele
text: Great beer selection and burgers. If you're on a diet forget it when you're here and endulge!

name: Gean Johnson
text: Food was above average and our waitress was very attentive to our needs. I'm not from Mobile so I was disappointed that there wasn't anything about the menu that significantly differentiated it from other places in the USA, other than the bacon wrapped Conecah sausage corn dog. It was good, but I was hoping for more.

name: Lakalan Madison
text: This place is great. The food was really good.  We ordered the Seared Tuna BLT & the Fried Shrimp Salad. Very well seasoned and the Mac n cheese was just how I like it. We love the location which is next door to the Saenger Theater. We sat outside on the corner right in the middle of every going on. Great food, great service, money well spent 🙂

name: Saul Jimenez
text: Delicious food and our server was very nice

name: Marc
text: Awesome food and beer! Definitely a must eat and drink!

name: Elisia Preudhomme
text: They have the best burgers in town and great selection of beers. One of my favorite local spots!!

name: Austin W
text: Visited for the first time because we wanted to try something different and the reviews sounded nice. Well we get there a little after three and we're told to sit anywhere and they would get to us in a minute. Well where we sat at we had to asked for it to be cleaned off and we had to ask a different waiter for menus. We order our food and we got an appetizer and two hamburgers. Well we get out drinks in about 7 minutes. So, we sit waiting for our appetizer to come thinking it would get to us in atleast 5-20 minutes but it didn't get to us until 48 minutes later. Well we were ready to leave by then but we decided to stay and wait on our actual food. That took another 30 minutes and we rushed to eat because we were going to see a movie. I really think our waiter didn't know what he was doing because we had to ask another waiter on our food and how much  longer it would take. No one came and really came and checked on us we had to ask if we ever needed anything else. Our waiter also did not wash his hands after handling money in which he went and refilled drinks.  Food was mediocre but the only thing good about this place was the atmosphere and bar. Other than that I don't think I'll be coming back we were there well over an hour just waiting.

name: Lucy Milstead
text: Was recommended this place because they have the best burgers in town. My family and I were not disappointed!! Great customer service and great food. Even had a kids menu.

name: Claire Lovejoy
text: The food was phenomenal, as always. Today Amir served us and he was the most genuine, personable, funniest, and informative waiter I’ve ever had anywhere! I will be coming back to sit in his section! LOVE LOVE LOVE

name: Fr. Dave Halt
text: Great beer garden. Huge beer menu. Awesome food. Beyond pub fare.  Try the seared tuna.

name: kevin hollins
text: Very nice lively place variety of people great staff

name: Emiley Robinson
text: Food and long island tea was very good

name: Jeffrey Weiland
text: payed for food that wasnt delivered, waited 40min, no reason given, another 15min for reimbursment, no apology, if you are a solo party do expect any service

name: yolanda clark
text: ABSOLUTELY amazing! We had a mini date and our server Brandon was amazing and attentive, we truly loved him...he even sat down and helped me pick the black cherry cider! I LOVE WINE! I DO NOT DRINK BEER AND CIDER TO ME IS BEER...but OMG THIS WAS A DELICIOUS SPARKLING WINE (CIDER) I love it, he's super professional and lighthearted! We got the gaint pretzel TDF must try! And egg rolls HE BROUGHT THEM OUT HOT AND TIMELY! We weren't there for long because service was so fast! We're truly impressed with the vibe and staff. Great dine out kitchen didn't close until 2am and the choices were vast. Well done! Forgive me for any typo it's late lol. But honest to God I had to post about our fantastic experience 4 items for only 30 with Togo! If you are done prior to 12 they'll even give you a togo cup for the strip! Loved it will return even visit here.

name: Kelli Pitts
text: Madison was awesome!!!! Enjoyed it! We WILL be back!

name: Rachel Krause
text: We had fantastic service and very clean place. The food was amazing. Our waiter was super knowledgeable with the beers and alternative suggestions. The menu is to die for...probably literally because it ain't calorie friendly.

name: Gracie Wilkerson
text: The food was ok. Nothing special. The service was horrible. We sat there for an hour and a half before getting most of our drinks.

name: Damien Neighbors
text: Food was great. People were great. All around an amazing experience, 10 out of 10.

name: Zachary Irvin
text: Absolutely delicious bar food. Service can be a but slow but if you're patient then their burgers are worth the wait.

name: Harley Dree
text: I have enjoyed this location many times. Impressive(!!!) beer selection with discounts on Sunday & Tuesday. Always kind service. Good food!! Large portions! Most menu items, if not all of them, are $15 or UNDER! Adult Milkshakes are dangerously tasty. Food may take a bit of time to get to you, but is hot & fresh. Recommended!

name: Blaine Adams
text:
I wanted to give 4 stars because I feel the food is very basic. But I just keep coming back.
I love the out door seating!

name: Christoffer Ahlstrøm
text: Great service, food was ok, the saus was amazing. The beer selection is insane.

name: Jessica Nicolaides
text: Beer and burgers!! You can't go wrong!! We were recommended this place by a few people while visiting Mobile and so glad we came! It did not disappoint! We were told to try the macaroni and cheese burger and the waffle burger so we did! They both were great but the waffle burger was amazing! 🤤🤤 Can't wait to come back! This place is definitely a must!

name: Carlos Nunez
text: Amazing beer, amazing food, and perfect mask compliance. Staff enforce masks at the door.

name: Paul West
text: The food is amazing,  I have found a  new burger joint.  This place is amazing and the service is second to none. Great atmosphere

name: Angelique Feagin
text: The server Shane was rude. I was not acknowledge while sitting to be waited on. I had to get someone's  attention. Young lady saw me sitting at the bar and proceeded to play on her phone. Was not asked anything after getting my food. Had a running egg on my burger for which I didn't ask for and was charged for it. When I said something about it he completely cut me off and dismissed what I had to say... Food was excellent but service was horrible

name: Eterniti Everlasting
text: By far one of my favorite downtown eateries. The beer is always cold and there is a phenomenal selection. The burgers are the best in town.

name: Michael Bossert
text: Burgers were a little overcooked but still very flavorful. Pretty good service, we never needed something and didnt get it. They were slammed when we went and still did not have to wait long at all.

name: Megan Bolton
text: Love the drinks but food has since over time. Decor is gorgeous

name: Susie Hartness
text: Great food. Really friendly staff.

name: Karl Bates
text: Great local biergarten. Lots of Sours and ciders on tap which is a rarity. Knowledgeable staff could recommend beers to you with your tastes in mind. Fantastic burgers, they claim to be the juiciest burgers in the world and you know what, their right. They were amazing, no one had any issues with any of there food. Great atmosphere. Highly suggest you try the ice cream sandwich made with donuts.

name: rodney webb
text: Great service, great atmosphere, and excellent food and portions!

name: Logan Elise
text: Great food and great atmosphere

name: Ralph Freeman
text: I had the Mac Attack and a Hefe Weizen and they were both outstanding! Excellent selection of beers and burgers coupled with good music and a lively staff. You would be a damn fool to overlook this place!!

name: Eric Johnson
text: Beer was hot, service was slow, food was hot but the hamburger bun crumbled in your hand from being stale.

name: Nadia Cox
text: Three visits within a week and each time we received horrible customer service. I won’t be visiting this location anymore and the West Mobile location is better.

name: Edward Steller
text: Normally when a place throws on a fee for a credit card I simply walk out, but I liked the set up for watching the game. Prices were too high my food was disappointing. Staff was friendly.

name: Jason Connell
text:
I absolutely loved the burger I got here! A crazy juicy concoction with, among other things,  maple-drizzled waffles instead of a bun. Never would've thought of that before, but it was awesome!

The server was quick and fun, and did a great job of recommending beers to fit our tastes.

Music was a bit loud for me, but we were sitting fairly close to the speaker and it wasn't enough to spoil my experience. It probably wouldn't bother most people.

name: Tasha Allen
text: Food was great,I had the German potato salad and the mac attack burger,,had a fried mac and cheese patty on top of the delicious medium rare Angus. Was nice sitting outside in downtown  Mobile.

name: Jason Whiddon
text: Food is great, and their beer selection is second to none around here.

name: Anthony Bro
text: The food was fantastic, the beer selection was one of the best I've ever seen, the staff was incredibly friendly and more than capable of answering any questions we had. Dispite the fact that it's ~2 hour drive, I will absolutely be coming back.

name: Lisa Moore
text: Food was decent but you didn't get tartar sauce with your fish, you had to pay an extra 75 cents if you wanted it and then our waitress brought back our change in bills but kept the actual change for herself which seemed really rude and shady. Definitely wouldn't recommend

name: Andrew Snyder
text: Awesome experience! Perfect hole in the wall location for a treat local pub/restaurant. Beer on tap is endless and food is amazing!

name: Christina Hall
text: Great service and good food.

name: Pawel Mazurek
text: Gigantic beer list and good food. Fantastic service and outstanding atmosphere

name: Robyn Koser
text: Love, love, love! Great staff, best draught beer selection and great food

name: Matthew Shephard
text:
Pretzel was kinda dry (informed the manager) but the beer cheese dipping sauce more than made up for it (my wife and I literally drank the remainder)!
Also the chili chili bang bang burger was super delicious (fair warning though: the structural integrity is severely compromised and pretty much requires utensils to eat without causing a disaster lol!)
Beer selection and the service were both great. Honestly, it'd have been about perfect had it not been for the dry pretzel, but I hope they'll have that corrected for my next visit 😊

name: Václav Navrátil (Aida)
text: Huge selection of beer, friendly stuff willing to go the extra mile helping the customers to find the perfect beer. Try the seared tuna sandwich with extra avocado, it is excellent.

name: Jacinta Watkins
text: There are multiple areas to eat - inside you can seat yourself at the bar, a table downstairs, or a table upstairs; or you can sit outside at a table. The latter option wouldn't be ideal at this time of year. The staff was friendly both times that I went. We sat at the bar this time & although we didn't order alcoholic drinks, I noticed that they weren't being stingy with the alcohol. Every time I saw a customer order a drink, the glass was filled to the rim & the bartender was friendly. The food was good. I must admit it was better the first time I went, though. We both ordered an Arnold Palmer to drink and weren't very satisfied with those, so we received a replacement drink of our choice at no charge! We also had (not pictured) the buffalo chicken rangoon app & they are delicious.

name: April Sprayberry
text: Great place! The burgers tasted wonderful! Mine was still pink on the inside because they are such thick burgers. Fries are fantastic! Great service. Will be going back when we go back to Mobile.

name: Secretly a celebrity
text: It sucks it's great

name: Kayla S
text: It was my first time going here while visiting home. They have a LARGE selection of beer on tap and bottles. I chose to try the purple haze on tap. So good! I also tried the jalapeño pretzel. It was very yummy. I would definitely go here again!

name: Kyle Pena
text: Good food and lot's of beer to choose from!

name: Darryl Graham
text:
